: : Kup : :
The Autobot drill seargent didn't have time to react. He ran into the gas and out the other side of the cloud.
Kup continued the chase but he could feel the effects start. His body was growing numb, paralizing.
Trying anything he could, Kup fired over Flicker, at the ceiling in front of him. This brings down a barrier of ruble in front of Flicker.
 cardhead649 <cardhead649@...> wrote:Flicker::

The spy narrowly avoids getting hit.  Without breaking stride, he 
pulls a canister from subspace and tosses it over his shoulder.  "Try 
this!  It's a gas!"  True enough, the canister hits the floor ahead 
of Kup and breaks open, releasing a dark cloud of pressurized aerosol 
sedative, capable of soaking through most armor plating and numbing a 
robot's body.

Flicker fervently hopes he won't have to pull too many more tricks 
out of his nearly-depleted stash ...

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> wrote:
> 
> : : Kup : :
> As soon as it went dark Kup moved, expecting an attack. He was 
right. Energy weapons shot at his former position.
> The light from the shots allowed Kup to see Flicker run. Kup 
followed after.
> Kup decided to take a calculated risk. He shot his plasma rifle 
low, sending shots at Flicker's feet. He shot low so not to hurt 
Nightlight.
> Kup: I hope your ready to die, lad!
>  cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...> wrote:OOC: Hey gimme a break, I'm 
only on once a day ...
> 
> Flicker::
> 
> The spy marks his enemies' locations carefully.  He pulls 
Nightlight 
> around so she's between him and Kup - the Autobot will have to 
shoot 
> through her to get him.  Then the hack device kicks in.  It opens 
> every door and hatchway in the base, then causes the power grid to 
> overload itself and blow out, plunging the base into darkness.  All 
> with Rodimus's access codes.
> 
> Flicker takes that as his cue.  His night-vision sensors already in 
> place, he suddenly shifts his aim and fires several blasts at 
> Condor.  He whips around and fires a couple times at Kup as well, 
> then dashes for the nearest exit, his hostage slung over his 
shoulder.
>
